question_sentence: Italian woman Ottavia Piana was rescued in the early hours of Wednesday morning after four days trapped in what?
evidence: Piana was one of a team of speleologists – scientists who study caves – mapping an unexplored area of the Abisso Bueno Fonteno cave system near Bergamo, when she fell several metres, sustaining multiple fractures. In a complex operation involving 150 rescue workers, she was finally brought to safety and is currently recovering in hospital.

question_sentence: Which Japanese carmakers are mulling a merger?
evidence: In a joint statement, the brands said they were "considering various possibilities for future collaboration, but no decisions have been made". If a merger goes ahead, the resulting company would be the world's third-largest carmaker by production and sales.

question_sentence: A trial of what form of autonomous transport has been cancelled in Scotland due to low uptake?
evidence: The 14-mile route between Edinburgh and Fife was operated by a fleet of five self-driving buses, although each one included a human driver at the wheel in case of emergencies. However, the £6 million project, which began in May, is to wind down due to low passenger numbers.

question_sentence: Which invasive species with a deadly sting has been eradicated from the US, five years after the first sighting?
evidence: The first giant hornet, also known as a "murder hornet", was spotted in Washington in 2019. "More than 1,000 'citizen scientists'" and state specialists tracked down and trapped the hornets to eradicate their nests. The last confirmed sighting was in 2021.

question_sentence: A novella by which 19th-century Russian author has become an unexpected viral sensation on TikTok?
evidence: "White Nights" has blown up on #booktok, more than 170 years after it was first published. It's unclear exactly how the novella first attracted attention on the platform, but The Guardian suspects that its theme of loneliness and readable length make it appealing to contemporary readers.

question_sentence: Which actor received the US Navy's top civilian honour?
evidence: The actor was given the Distinguished Public Service Award during a ceremony at Longcross Studios in Surrey in recognition of his "outstanding contributions to the Navy and the Marine Corps" for his work in "Top Gun" and other films.

question_sentence: The Chinese businessman and friend of Prince Andrew deemed a national security risk was referred to by what codename?
evidence: Yang Tengbo, whose identity was finally revealed on Monday, was banned from the UK last week. Yang had appealed a decision last year to expel him, but an appeals court upheld the verdict, saying the then home secretary, Suella Braverman, was "entitled to conclude" that he posed a risk to national security.

question_sentence: Australian breakdancer Raygun has reached an agreement to allow what kind of show, inspired by her Olympic viral fame?
evidence: The dancer, real name Rachael Gunn, had taken legal action to block the staging of comedian Steph Broadbridge's show "Raygun: The Musical". However, the pair have now come to an agreement that will allow the performance to go ahead, under the name "Breaking the Musical".

question_sentence: Which model plays Elton John in a new video for his 1973 Christmas classic "Step Into Christmas"?
evidence: The model said Elton John was an "idol" of hers and that being approached to don his signature get-up for the recreation was a "dream that I didn’t know I had until it happened". The clip is a whimsical riff on the original, framed as a behind-the-scenes glimpse at the making of the 1973 video.

question_sentence: A state of emergency has been declared in which US state after a series of bird flu outbreaks?
evidence: Governor Gavin Newsom declared a state of emergency as H5N1 avian flu outbreaks spread southwards from dairies in the state's Central Valley. The proclamation came after federal health officials reported the nation's first severe bird flu infection in a Louisiana resident.

question_sentence: Why was the US Wind permit for an offshore wind project denied by Sussex County Council
choices: The project benefits flow to the state of Maryland

question_sentence: Which company is taking over the ILG hangar at Wilmington Airport?
Where is the Philadelphia 76ers' proposed new arena, 76 Place, planned to be located?
What significant decision did First Lady Jill Biden announce regarding her teaching career?
choices: She will start teaching at a new university
She will leave her teaching position

question_sentence: What misconduct was former Nemours Children's Health researcher Valerie Sampson found guilty of?
How much did the University of Delaware agree to pay to settle claims related to a professor's undisclosed ties to China?
For which film was Delaware actress Zoe Ziegler nominated for a Critics Choice Award?
What record is Saquon Barkley of the Eagles close to breaking?
choices: Most passing yards in a season

question_sentence: Why is Nick's Pizza closing its Prices Corner site?
choices: Moving to a larger location in North Wilmington

question_sentence: Where was the endangered piping plover, Elwood, spotted after hatching in Delaware?
Which objects have been spotted in the sky across the Northeast, prompting an FBI investigation?
evidence: Numerous drone sightings have put pressure on federal agencies to provide more information about the mysterious aircraft. Officials have urged calm and emphasized there is no evidence suggesting the sightings pose a security threat.

question_sentence: America’s first severe case of bird flu was confirmed this week in which state?
evidence: A patient in Louisiana has been hospitalized with a severe case of H5N1 bird flu, the CDC said, the first such case in the United States.

question_sentence: Which social media app is facing a potential ban in the US on January 19?
evidence: The Supreme Court on Wednesday agreed to decide whether a controversial ban on the social media app TikTok violates the First Amendment, adding a major case to its docket this term just before President-elect Donald Trump takes office.

question_sentence: Which Supreme Court justice recently fulfilled another one of her life’s goals by appearing in a Broadway show?
evidence: Supreme Court Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson took the stage in a one-night performance of “& Juliet” on Broadway.

question_sentence: Which two automakers are discussing a possible merger?
evidence: Japanese automakers Honda and Nissan are in merger talks, but they offered no details or timeframe for when a deal — if one should develop — may be completed.

question_sentence: Which Pacific nation was struck by a 7.3 magnitude earthquake this week?
evidence: A deadly 7.3-magnitude earthquake hit Vanuatu on Tuesday, sparking a network outage, crushing vehicles and damaging multiple buildings.

question_sentence: Which pharmacy chain is facing a lawsuit for allegedly filling illegal opioid prescriptions?
evidence: The Department of Justice announced a lawsuit on Wednesday accusing CVS of filling illegal opioid prescriptions and billing federal health insurance programs, contributing to a nationwide epidemic of opioid addiction and overdoses.

question_sentence: Which invasive insect has been declared eradicated in the US?
evidence: The world’s largest hornet, an invasive breed dubbed the “murder hornet,” has been declared eradicated in the US.

question_sentence: Which basketball team won the second annual NBA Cup?
evidence: The Milwaukee Bucks won the second annual NBA Cup after stifling the Oklahoma City Thunder 97-81 in Las Vegas on Tuesday. Star forward Giannis Antetokounmpo was named MVP.

question_sentence: Which actor received an award from the US Navy this week?
evidence: “Top Gun” star Tom Cruise was honored with the Department of the Navy Distinguished Public Service Award, which recognized Cruise’s contribution and dedication to the US Navy through his film work. It is the Navy's highest honor that a person outside of the department can receive.
